meanings.definition: Farthest from the center or middle.
meanings.sent1: The outmost star in the sky twinkled brightly.
meanings.sent2: She placed the outmost book on the shelf.
meanings.sent3: The outmost cookie in the jar always disappears first.
meanings.sent4: His outmost effort in the race earned him a gold medal.
meanings.sent5: The outmost edge of the cliff offered a breathtaking view of the valley below.

meanings.sent1: Her outmost desire was to travel the world.
meanings.sent2: He showed his outmost respect for the elderly.
meanings.sent3: The outmost joy filled her heart when she saw her family.
meanings.sent4: Their outmost dedication to the project led to its success.
meanings.sent5: The outmost kindness he showed to strangers was truly admirable.
